ModuleDescription: Students will work with nude models, study human anatomy, learn to depict the figure in various mediums. Students will draw, paint, sculpt, and challenge the limits what a figure is, and what makes a representation of the human. It will also look at body politics through art making, and the relationship between artist-artwork-viewer. The class will look at gesture drawing, classical painting, contemporary and conceptual works. Students will develop a portfolio of drawings in various media, and make a selection for a final, public exhibition with the class. The course fulfils the practice requirement within the Arts & Humanities.
